page.title: 07Transport In Newburgh
page.content: Cars and buses are both used for transport in this area.The bus service run by the Regional Council is limited because of the small population.It is mainly used by older people.The 52 seater buses used are normally sufficient.Many families have more than one car and since most people have to leave the village to go to work the roads are busy.Further traffic is added because of vehicles passing through on their way North or South.At certain agricultural seasons the traffic is increased because of more farm vehicles.There are two lorry companies in Newburgh.T.N.T.which stands for Thomas Nationwide Transport carries goods all over the country and guarantees fast delivery.The other firm, Cruickshanks, works locally,carrying cattle to and from the market in Aberdeen.
